name: YouTube Live
primary_goal_vibe: Real-time education, launches, Q&A, community interaction, and long-form relationship building.
tone_preference: Professional, direct, and interactive. Less polished than edited content, more conversational.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: The live title must clearly state the topic and benefit. The description should explain what will happen, who it is for, and what viewers gain by staying. Use pinned messages and verbal reminders for CTAs throughout the session.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Title: topic plus outcome. Description: short overview, agenda bullets, guest info, and main CTA. End with links and hashtags.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Short to medium. Enough to remove uncertainty and drive attendance.
cta_examples: Set a reminder for the live session
Ask your questions in the chat
Subscribe to get notified next time
Download the resource in the description
Stay until the end for Q&A

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Guide viewers through the session and reinforce context.
best_practices: Use pinned chat messages for topic and CTA
Display speaker names and segments when relevant

hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Use consistent series or topic hashtags across live sessions.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Mention guests, partners, or sponsors in the description.

technical_constraints.recommended_duration: 30–90 minutes depending on topic and audience size.
technical_constraints.connection_note: Wired connection recommended. Test audio, lighting, and framing before going live.
technical_constraints.replay_behavior: Live recordings remain available as regular videos unless disabled.

required_elements: Description with agenda or session flow
Primary CTA repeated during the live
disallowed_practices: Starting without explaining the session purpose
Long idle time before content begins
Vague live titles with no clear benefit
